#summary Standard library versions and environment variables

Hackystat services tend to use a set of common library files.  To facilitate development, this page lists libraries or other development infrastructure for which we believe it will be useful to establish a "standard" version and "standard" environment variable.  The goal is to enable local environment configuration for one Hackystat service to not conflict with the local environment configuration for another Hackystat service.  

|| *Package* || *Standard Version* || *Standard Environment/Classpath Variable* ||
|| [http://ant.apache.org/ Ant] || 1.7.0 || ANT_HOME || 
|| [http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/ CheckStyle] || 4.3 || CHECKSTYLE_HOME ||
|| [http://emma.sourceforge.net/ EMMA] || 2.0.5312 ||  EMMA_HOME || 
|| [http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/ FindBugs] || 1.2.0 || FINDBUGS_HOME || 
|| [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/versions.html Google Web Toolkit] || 1.4.10 || GWT_HOME ||
|| [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-utilities Hackystat Utilities] || (most recent milestone) || HACKYSTAT_UTILITIES_HOME ||
|| [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensorbase-uh Hackystat Sensorbase] || (most recent milestone) || HACKYSTAT_SENSORBASE_HOME ||
|| [http://code.google.com/p/hackystat-sensor-shell Hackystat SensorShell] || (most recent milestone) || HACKYSTAT_SENSORSHELL_HOME ||
|| [http://java.sun.com/ Java] || 1.5 or 1.6 || JAVA_HOME || 
|| [http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html JDepend] || 2.9 || JDEPEND_HOME ||
|| [http://www.jfree.org/jfreechart/download.html JFreeChart] || 1.0.5 || JFREECHART_HOME ||
|| [http://www.junit.org JUnit] || 4.3.1 || JUNIT_HOME || 
|| [http://pmd.sourceforge.net/ PMD] || 3.9 || PMD_HOME ||  
|| [http://www.restlet.org/ Restlet] || 1.0.5 || RESTLET_HOME || 
|| [http://tomcat.apache.org/ Tomcat] || 6.0.13 || CATALINA_HOME ||

Note that if your service really needs to deviate from the standard version for some good reason, then the way to do it is to specify a service-specific environment variable. For example, if a Hackystat service named Foo needs to use a different version of Google Web Toolkit than the standard version listed above, then it should specify something like the following in its developer guide:

|| [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/versions.html Google Web Toolkit] || 1.3 || FOO_GWT_HOME ||
